metadata.Title: CVE-2015-6761 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The update_dimensions function in libavcodec/vp8.c in FFmpeg through 2.8.1,as used in Google Chrome before 46.0.2490.71 and other products, relies ona coefficient-partition count during multi-threaded operation, which allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (race condition and memorycorruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted WebMfile.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6761` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
chromium-browser-l10n - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
chromium-chromedriver - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.15.10.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.15.10.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.15.10.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.15.10.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.15.10.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.15.10.1
No subscription required

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.3-1
libav-tools - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.3-1
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10.3-0ubuntu0.15.10.1').
ffmpeg package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.3-1').
